## Exerci»õii pentru Cupluri: Practica √émpreunƒÉ

## Mai Multe Resurse pentru Cupluri

Vrei sƒÉ √Æ»õi surprinzi partenerul cu mai multe expresii romantice? ExploreazƒÉ [ghidul nostru despre termeni de afec»õiune √Æn englezƒÉ](/learn/ro/en/english-terms-of-endearment-for-your-partner/) pentru a √ÆnvƒÉ»õa cele mai dulci moduri de a-»õi exprima iubirea. De asemenea, [expresiile romantice pentru fiecare ocazie](/learn/ro/en/romantic-english-phrases-for-every-occasion/) te vor ajuta sƒÉ gƒÉse»ôti cuvintele perfecte pentru momentele speciale √ÆmpreunƒÉ.

Pentru a vƒÉ pregƒÉti de √Ænt√¢lniri romantice, nu rata»õi [vocabularul pentru o searƒÉ perfectƒÉ](/learn/ro/en/english-date-night-vocabulary/) - con»õine toate cuvintele de care ave»õi nevoie pentru o cinƒÉ romanticƒÉ sau o ie»ôire specialƒÉ.

## UrmeazƒÉ √Æn CƒÉlƒÉtoria VoastrƒÉ

Pronun»õia este doar √Ænceputul! C√¢nd stƒÉp√¢ni»õi aceste sunete de bazƒÉ, ve»õi observa cum conversa»õiile voastre devin mai naturale »ôi mai pline de √Æncredere. Continua»õi sƒÉ practica»õi √ÆmpreunƒÉ - poate cƒÉ nu ve»õi fi perfec»õi peste noapte, dar ve»õi fi perfec»õi unul pentru celƒÉlalt √Æn efortul vostru de a comunica mai bine.

Re»õine»õi: nu este vorba despre a avea un accent perfect, ci despre a vƒÉ exprima dragostea clar »ôi sincer. Fiecare "I love you" pronun»õat cu grijƒÉ »ôi inten»õie este mai puternic dec√¢t unul rostit mecanic, indiferent de accent.

articles.title: German Christmas Traditions for Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

German Christmas traditions are some of the most magical in the world. From enchanting Weihnachtsm√§rkte to the cozy ritual of Adventskalender, learning these customs brings you closer to German culture - and to each other. Let's explore how to celebrate Weihnachten like a German couple!

## Essential Christmas Vocabulary

<VocabCard
  word="Frohe Weihnachten!"
  translation="Merry Christmas!"
  pronunciation="[FROH-eh VY-nahkh-ten]"
  example="The most important holiday greeting!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="der Heiligabend"
  translation="Christmas Eve"
  pronunciation="[dehr HY-likh-ah-bent]"
  example="Germans celebrate mainly on Christmas Eve, not Christmas Day."
/>

### Core Christmas Words

| German | English | Pronunciation |
|--------|---------|---------------|
| Weihnachten | Christmas | [VY-nahkh-ten] |
| der Weihnachtsbaum | Christmas tree | [VY-nahkhts-bowm] |
| der Weihnachtsmarkt | Christmas market | [VY-nahkhts-markt] |
| der Adventskalender | Advent calendar | [ahd-VENTS-kah-len-der] |
| der Adventskranz | Advent wreath | [ahd-VENTS-krahnts] |
| das Weihnachtslied | Christmas carol | [VY-nahkhts-leet] |
| die Bescherung | gift giving | [beh-SHAY-roong] |
| der Weihnachtsmann | Santa Claus | [VY-nahkhts-mahn] |
| das Christkind | Christ Child | [KRIST-kint] |

<CultureTip title="Heiligabend - The Main Event" flag="üá©üá™">
Unlike in English-speaking countries, Germans celebrate Christmas primarily on December 24th (Heiligabend). Families gather, exchange gifts in the evening, and often attend church services. December 25th and 26th are for relaxing with family.
</CultureTip>

## The Advent Season (Die Adventszeit)

The four weeks before Christmas are called Advent, filled with special traditions:

<VocabCard
  word="der Adventskranz"
  translation="Advent wreath"
  pronunciation="[ahd-VENTS-krahnts]"
  example="A wreath with four candles - light one each Sunday before Christmas."
/>

### Advent Traditions

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| die Adventskerze | Advent candle |
| der erste/zweite/dritte/vierte Advent | first/second/third/fourth Advent Sunday |
| Adventskalender √∂ffnen | opening the Advent calendar |
| Pl√§tzchen backen | baking Christmas cookies |
| Gl√ºhwein trinken | drinking mulled wine |

<VocabCard
  word="Machen wir zusammen einen Adventskranz?"
  translation="Shall we make an Advent wreath together?"
  pronunciation="[MAH-khen veer tsoo-ZAM-men AI-nen ahd-VENTS-krahnts]"
  example="A romantic activity for couples!"
/>

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Das erste T√ºrchen √∂ffnen"
  translation="Opening the first door (of the Advent calendar)"
  pronunciation="[dahs ERS-teh TUER-khen ERF-nen]"
  context="On December 1st, Germans start opening daily doors on their Advent calendar."
/>

## The Christmas Market (Weihnachtsmarkt)

Christmas markets are the heart of German holiday season:

<VocabCard
  word="Gehen wir auf den Weihnachtsmarkt?"
  translation="Shall we go to the Christmas market?"
  pronunciation="[GAY-en veer owf dayn VY-nahkhts-markt]"
  example="A romantic date idea for the season!"
/>

### What You'll Find at the Market

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| der Gl√ºhwein | mulled wine |
| die Bratwurst | fried sausage |
| gebrannte Mandeln | roasted almonds |
| der Lebkuchen | gingerbread |
| der Stollen | fruit bread/cake |
| die Weihnachtspyramide | Christmas pyramid |
| der Nussknacker | nutcracker |
| die Christbaumkugel | Christmas ornament |
| das Kunsthandwerk | handicrafts |

<VocabCard
  word="Zwei Gl√ºhwein, bitte!"
  translation="Two mulled wines, please!"
  pronunciation="[tsvy GLUE-vine BIT-teh]"
  example="Essential for warming up at the market!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Famous Christmas Markets" flag="üá©üá™">
Germany's most famous Christmas markets include Nuremberg (Christkindlesmarkt), Dresden (Striezelmarkt), and Cologne (with markets near the cathedral). Each has unique traditions and specialties. Visiting one together is a magical couples' experience!
</CultureTip>

## Decorating the Tree (Den Baum schm√ºcken)

<VocabCard
  word="Lass uns den Weihnachtsbaum schm√ºcken"
  translation="Let's decorate the Christmas tree"
  pronunciation="[lahs oons dayn VY-nahkhts-bowm SHMUE-ken]"
  example="A beloved couples' activity!"
/>

### Tree Decorations

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| der Christbaum | Christmas tree (regional) |
| der Tannenbaum | fir tree |
| die Lichterkette | string of lights |
| die Kerze | candle |
| der Stern | star |
| der Engel | angel |
| das Lametta | tinsel |
| der Baumschmuck | tree decorations |

<VocabCard
  word="Wer setzt den Stern auf die Spitze?"
  translation="Who puts the star on top?"
  pronunciation="[vehr zetst dayn shtern owf dee SHPIT-seh]"
  example="Deciding who gets the honor!"
/>

### Traditional vs. Modern Trees

German trees traditionally featured real candles (Kerzen) instead of electric lights. Some families still use real candles, keeping a bucket of water nearby! Most modern families use Lichterketten (string lights), but the traditional look remains special.

## Christmas Eve Traditions

<VocabCard
  word="die Bescherung"
  translation="gift-giving ceremony"
  pronunciation="[beh-SHAY-roong]"
  example="The moment when presents are opened on Christmas Eve."
/>

### Christmas Eve Timeline

| Time | Tradition |
|------|-----------|
| Morning/Afternoon | Prepare food, last-minute decorating |
| Late Afternoon | Children sent away while tree is revealed |
| Early Evening | Church service (Christmette) |
| Evening | Bescherung (gift opening) |
| Dinner | Traditional Christmas meal |

### Gift Phrases

<VocabCard
  word="Das ist f√ºr dich"
  translation="This is for you"
  pronunciation="[dahs ist fuer dikh]"
  example="When giving a present to your partner."
/>

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| Vielen Dank f√ºr das sch√∂ne Geschenk! | Thank you for the beautiful gift! |
| Das wollte ich schon immer haben! | I've always wanted this! |
| Du kennst mich so gut | You know me so well |
| Das hast du selbst gemacht? | Did you make this yourself? |
| Ich liebe es! | I love it! |

<CultureTip title="Christkind vs. Weihnachtsmann" flag="üá©üá™">
In Northern Germany, the Weihnachtsmann (Santa Claus) brings gifts. In Southern Germany and Austria, it's the Christkind (Christ Child), an angel-like figure. Both arrive on Heiligabend, not December 25th!
</CultureTip>

## Christmas Music and Carols

Singing together creates beautiful memories:

<VocabCard
  word="Stille Nacht, heilige Nacht"
  translation="Silent Night, Holy Night"
  pronunciation="[SHTIL-leh nahkht HY-likh-eh nahkht]"
  example="The most famous German Christmas carol, written in Austria in 1818."
/>

### Popular German Christmas Songs

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| Stille Nacht | Silent Night |
| O Tannenbaum | O Christmas Tree |
| Leise rieselt der Schnee | Softly Falls the Snow |
| Ihr Kinderlein kommet | Come, Little Children |
| Kling, Gl√∂ckchen | Ring, Little Bell |
| O du fr√∂hliche | O How Joyfully |

<VocabCard
  word="Singen wir zusammen ein Weihnachtslied?"
  translation="Shall we sing a Christmas carol together?"
  pronunciation="[ZING-en veer tsoo-ZAM-men ine VY-nahkhts-leet]"
  example="A romantic holiday activity!"
/>

## Traditional Christmas Foods

<VocabCard
  word="das Weihnachtsessen"
  translation="Christmas dinner"
  pronunciation="[VY-nahkhts-es-sen]"
  example="Traditional meals vary by region."
/>

### Traditional Christmas Foods

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| die Weihnachtsgans | Christmas goose |
| der Karpfen | carp |
| das Kartoffelsalat | potato salad |
| die W√ºrstchen | sausages |
| der Stollen | Christmas fruit bread |
| die Pl√§tzchen | Christmas cookies |
| der Lebkuchen | gingerbread |
| die Vanillekipferl | vanilla crescent cookies |
| der Spekulatius | spiced cookies |

<VocabCard
  word="Backen wir zusammen Pl√§tzchen?"
  translation="Shall we bake Christmas cookies together?"
  pronunciation="[BAH-ken veer tsoo-ZAM-men PLETS-khen]"
  example="A wonderful holiday tradition for couples!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Regional Christmas Meals" flag="üá©üá™">
Christmas Eve dinner varies by region. In some areas, it's simple - potato salad with sausages. In others, it's elaborate - goose or carp with all the trimmings. Many families have their own traditions passed down through generations.
</CultureTip>

## Nikolaustag (December 6th)

Don't confuse this with Christmas! St. Nicholas Day is a separate celebration:

<VocabCard
  word="der Nikolaustag"
  translation="St. Nicholas Day"
  pronunciation="[NIK-oh-lows-tahk]"
  example="December 6th - children put out shoes for treats!"
/>

### Nikolaus Traditions

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| den Stiefel putzen | polishing boots (to put out) |
| der Nikolaus | St. Nicholas |
| Knecht Ruprecht | Nikolaus's helper |
| kleine Geschenke | small gifts |
| S√º√üigkeiten | sweets |
| N√ºsse | nuts |
| Orangen | oranges |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Hast du deinen Stiefel rausgestellt?"
  translation="Did you put your boot out?"
  pronunciation="[hahst doo DY-nen SHTEE-fel ROWS-geh-shtelt]"
  context="On December 5th evening, children put out boots for Nikolaus to fill with treats!"
/>

## New Year's Eve (Silvester)

While not Christmas, it's part of the holiday season:

<VocabCard
  word="Silvester"
  translation="New Year's Eve"
  pronunciation="[zil-VES-ter]"
  example="December 31st in Germany."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Frohes neues Jahr!"
  translation="Happy New Year!"
  pronunciation="[FROH-es NOY-es yahr]"
  example="Say this at midnight!"
/>

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| Guten Rutsch! | Happy slide (into the new year)! |
| das Feuerwerk | fireworks |
| der Sekt | sparkling wine |
| Bleigie√üen | lead pouring (traditional) |
| die Neujahrsvors√§tze | New Year's resolutions |

## Creating Your Own Traditions

<VocabCard
  word="Das kann unsere Tradition werden"
  translation="That can become our tradition"
  pronunciation="[dahs kahn OON-zeh-reh trah-dit-TSEE-ohn VEHR-den]"
  example="Starting new traditions as a couple."
/>

### Ideas for Couples

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| zusammen Pl√§tzchen backen | baking cookies together |
| den Adventskranz selbst machen | making your own Advent wreath |
| auf den Weihnachtsmarkt gehen | going to the Christmas market |
| gemeinsam den Baum schm√ºcken | decorating the tree together |
| deutsche Weihnachtsfilme schauen | watching German Christmas movies |
| zusammen Weihnachtslieder singen | singing Christmas carols together |

## Practice Activities for Couples

### Activity 1: Advent Calendar Exchange
Create Advent calendars for each other with small German vocabulary cards, love notes, or tiny gifts.

### Activity 2: Cook a German Christmas Meal
Prepare traditional German Christmas foods together while practicing the vocabulary.

### Activity 3: Learn a German Carol
Choose a German Christmas song and learn to sing it together by Christmas Eve.

<CTA text="Ready to celebrate Weihnachten in German?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />

–ü–æ—Ä—Ç—É–≥–∞–ª—å—Å–∫–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∞ –Ω–∞ –∏—Å–ø–∞–Ω—Å–∫—É—é –∏ –∏—Ç–∞–ª—å—è–Ω—Å–∫—É—é. –î–ª—è —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—â–∏—Ö –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º—ã —Ä–æ–¥—ã –∏ —Å–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è, –Ω–æ –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±—É—é—Ç –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è.

## –†–æ–¥ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Masculino e feminino"
  translation="–ú—É–∂—Å–∫–æ–π –∏ –∂–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π —Ä–æ–¥"
  pronunciation="–º–∞—Å–∫—É–ª–∏–Ω—É –∏ —Ñ—ç–º–∏–Ω–∏–Ω—É"
  context="–í –ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É–≥–∞–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–º —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –¥–≤–∞ —Ä–æ–¥–∞ (–Ω–µ—Ç —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≥–æ)"
/>

### –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ:

<VocabCard
  word="-O = –º—É–∂—Å–∫–æ–π, -A = –∂–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π"
  translation="–û–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è—é—Ç —Ä–æ–¥"
  pronunciation="‚Äî"
  example="Menino (–º.—Ä.), menina (–∂.—Ä.)"
/>

| –û–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏–µ | –†–æ–¥ | –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã |
|-----------|-----|---------|
| **-o** | –º—É–∂—Å–∫–æ–π | menino, livro, amor |
| **-a** | –∂–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π | menina, casa, vida |
| **-e** | –æ–±–∞ | estudante (–º/–∂) |

<CultureTip title="–ò—Å–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è" flag="üáßüá∑">
–ù–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ –Ω–∞ -a –º—É–∂—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–æ–¥–∞: o problema (–ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞), o sistema (—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞), o cinema (–∫–∏–Ω–æ—Ç–µ–∞—Ç—Ä). –≠—Ç–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ –≥—Ä–µ—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏—Å—Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è.
</CultureTip>

## –ê—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª–∏

### –û–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª–∏ (o, a, os, as)

<VocabCard
  word="O menino, a menina"
  translation="–ú–∞–ª—å—á–∏–∫, –¥–µ–≤–æ—á–∫–∞ (–∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ)"
  pronunciation="—É –º—ç–Ω–∏–Ω—É, –∞ –º—ç–Ω–∏–Ω–∞"
  example="O menino que eu amo ‚Äî –º–∞–ª—å—á–∏–∫, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –ª—é–±–ª—é"
/>

| –†–æ–¥ | –ï–¥. —á–∏—Å–ª–æ | –ú–Ω. —á–∏—Å–ª–æ |
|-----|-----------|-----------|
| –ú | **o** | **os** |
| –ñ | **a** | **as** |

–ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä—ã:
- **o livro** ‚Üí os livros (–∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞ ‚Üí –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∏)
- **a casa** ‚Üí as casas (–¥–æ–º ‚Üí –¥–æ–º–∞)
- **o amor** ‚Üí os amores (–ª—é–±–æ–≤—å ‚Üí –ª—é–±–æ–≤–∏)

### –ù–µ–æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª–∏ (um, uma)

<VocabCard
  word="Um menino, uma menina"
  translation="(–ö–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ) –º–∞–ª—å—á–∏–∫, –¥–µ–≤–æ—á–∫–∞"
  pronunciation="—É–º –º—ç–Ω–∏–Ω—É, —É–º–∞ –º—ç–Ω–∏–Ω–∞"
  example="Conheci um cara legal ‚Äî –Ø –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏–ª—Å—è —Å (–æ–¥–Ω–∏–º) –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–Ω—ã–º –ø–∞—Ä–Ω–µ–º"
/>

| –†–æ–¥ | –ï–¥. —á–∏—Å–ª–æ | –ú–Ω. —á–∏—Å–ª–æ |
|-----|-----------|-----------|
| –ú | **um** | **uns** |
| –ñ | **uma** | **umas** |

## –°–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤

### –¢—Ä–∏ –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤

<VocabCard
  word="-AR, -ER, -IR"
  translation="–¢—Ä–∏ —Ç–∏–ø–∞ –æ–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–∏–≤–∞"
  pronunciation="–∞—Ä, —ç—Ä, –∏—Ä"
  example="Amar (–ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å), comer (–µ—Å—Ç—å), partir (—É–µ–∑–∂–∞—Ç—å)"
/>

### AMAR (–ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å) ‚Äî –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª—ã –Ω–∞ -AR

| –ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –°–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ |
|-------------|-----------|--------------|
| eu | am**o** | –∞–º—É |
| voc√™/ele/ela | am**a** | –∞–º–∞ |
| n√≥s | am**amos** | –∞–º–∞ÃÅ–º—É—Å |
| voc√™s/eles/elas | am**am** | –∞–º–∞–º |

### COMER (–µ—Å—Ç—å) ‚Äî –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª—ã –Ω–∞ -ER

| –ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –°–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ |
|-------------|-----------|--------------|
| eu | com**o** | –∫–æ–º—É |
| voc√™/ele/ela | com**e** | –∫–æ–º–∏ |
| n√≥s | com**emos** | –∫–æ–º—ç–º—É—Å |
| voc√™s/eles/elas | com**em** | –∫–æ–º—ç–º |

### PARTIR (—É–µ–∑–∂–∞—Ç—å) ‚Äî –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª—ã –Ω–∞ -IR

| –ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –°–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ |
|-------------|-----------|--------------|
| eu | part**o** | –ø–∞—Ä—Ç—É |
| voc√™/ele/ela | part**e** | –ø–∞—Ä—á–∏ |
| n√≥s | part**imos** | –ø–∞—Ä—á–∏–º—É—Å |
| voc√™s/eles/elas | part**em** | –ø–∞—Ä—Ç—ç–º |

<CultureTip title="Tu vs Voc√™" flag="üáßüá∑üáµüáπ">
–í –ë—Ä–∞–∑–∏–ª–∏–∏ —á–∞—â–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é—Ç ¬´voc√™¬ª (–í—ã/—Ç—ã), –≤ –ü–æ—Ä—Ç—É–≥–∞–ª–∏–∏ ‚Äî ¬´tu¬ª. –°–ø—Ä—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–ª—è voc√™ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –∂–µ, –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è ele/ela (3-–µ –ª–∏—Ü–æ). –≠—Ç–æ —É–ø—Ä–æ—â–∞–µ—Ç –∏–∑—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ!
</CultureTip>

## –í–∞–∂–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª—ã

### SER (–±—ã—Ç—å ‚Äî –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω–æ–µ)

articles.title: Wegierskie romantyczne zwroty na ka≈ºda okazje
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

Kazda okazja zasluguje na odpowiednie s≈Çowa. Ten przewodnik nauczy cie wegierskich romantycznych zwrotow na rozne momenty waszego zwiazku - od pierwszych spotkan po najwa≈ºniejsze rocznice. Polacz je z [wegierskimi zdrobnieniami](/learn/pl/hu/hungarian-pet-names-terms-of-endearment/) dla pelnego efektu!

## Pierwsza randka

  pronunciation="na-djon iz-ga-tott wa-djok"

/>

| Wegierski | Wymowa | Polski |

| **Alig v√°rtam, hogy l√°ssalak** | a-lig war-tam, hodj lasz-sza-lak | Nie moglem/am siƒô doczekac, ≈ºeby cie zobaczyc |
| **Sz√©p vagy ma este** | sep wadj ma esz-te | Wygladasz pieknie dzis wieczorem |
| **Nagyon j√≥l √©rzem magam veled** | na-djon jol er-zem ma-gam we-led | Bardzo dobrze siƒô z toba czuje |
| **Rem√©lem, √∫jra tal√°lkozunk** | re-me-lem, uj-ra ta-lal-ko-zunk | Mam nadzieje, ≈ºe siƒô znowu spotkamy |

<CultureTip title="Pierwsza randka po wegiersku" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Wegierscy cenia szczerosc i bezposredniosc. Nie boj siƒô mowic, co czujesz - to jest cenione bardziej niz gra i udawanie.
</CultureTip>
